p: Effects of the fumigation and contact of the 18 PEOs on the conidial germination of V. virens are shown in Table 1. In the fumigation activity test, A. dahurica oil, A. tatarinowii rhizome oil, cinnamon bark oil, cinnamon oil L. cubeba oil and myrrh oil exhibited 100% inhibition on conidial germination, and thyme oil inhibited 86.5% of the conidial germination of V. virens at the concentration of 7.5 μL/L air. In the contact activity tests, only cinnamon bark and cinnamon oils completely inhibited conidial germination. However, the other 16 PEOs had no significant inhibitory effect on the conidial germination of V. virens.
